Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election Bernard Avishai If the final polls on the Israeli election are to be believed—by law, there will be no more revealed before the voting begins, on Tuesday morning—things are looking better for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s Likud Party than for Blue and White, the new centrist party led by the former military Chief of Staff Benny Gantz.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: The two continue to run neck and neck in the race for a plurality in the Knesset—with about thirty seats each, out of a total of a hundred and twenty.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: But both are running with a bloc of smaller parties, and Netanyahu’s bloc seems more likely than Gantz’s to win a sixty-one-seat Knesset majority.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: The President typically bestows a mandate to form a government on the leader of the party that wins a plurality—except in cases where a bloc of parties led by someone else wins a clear majority.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: That is how Netanyahu won in 2009, and it’s why the polls still favor him.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: A majority of voters are now either hoping that he will remain in office, or are bracing for it.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: In a recent Channel 12 poll, fifty-eight per cent of respondents said that Netanyahu will be the next Prime Minister.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: But only thirty-six per cent wanted him to be.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Given the quirks of the Israeli electoral system, though, the polls may prove misleading.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: The margin of error is around four per cent, which means that it may be impossible to divine the fates of the all-important smaller parties.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Each must win three and a quarter per cent of the total vote in order to enter the Knesset; a vote for a party that does not clear that threshold is simply wasted.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Fully seven parties—two in Gantz’s potential bloc, five in Netanyahu’s—have been polling close to extinction at various points in the campaign.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Moreover, according to an April 2nd poll, more than eight per cent of voters are still undecided.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: So Gantz’s bloc could squeak out a win.

Sentence: Or Netanyahu’s could win in a landslide.

Sentence: Or either leader could win a plurality for his party, but not a majority for his bloc.

Sentence: In fact, the polls reveal little about the serious difficulties that either of them, even with a clear win, will face in forming a government.

Sentence: Consider the head-spinning possibilities: Gantz wins outright—and his problems begin.

Sentence: For Blue and White to win a plurality, a significant number of secular, formerly right-of-center voters will have to support it.

Sentence: So will a significant number of young first-time voters.

Sentence: This is a tall order: to most Israelis, the business sector seems strong, as does the deterrence of enemies, and Netanyahu gets credit for both.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: So even young Israelis tend to skew right.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: A poll conducted by the Israel Democracy Institute shows that among Israelis aged sixty-five and older, Gantz beats Netanyahu fifty-three per cent to thirty-five; among voters aged eighteen to twenty-four, Netanyahu beats Gantz sixty-five per cent to seventeen.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Gantz and his allies have been courting these secular, security-minded voters, promising to provide a hard line on security—three of the four senior leaders of Blue and White are former generals—and that he will form a government only with Zionist (read: non-Arab) parties.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: He is also stressing the importance of the rule of law, warning of Netanyahu’s alliance with messianists and proto-fascist followers of the late Rabbi Meir Kahane—of the danger that Netanyahu is turning Israel into an authoritarian theocracy, as Recep Tayyip Erdoğan has done in Turkey—and promising to force ultra-Orthodox Haredi schools, which focus on religious studies, to also teach such basic subjects as math and English.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: He is presenting himself as a return to an eclipsed, progressive Israeliness.

Sentence: For that, it will have to hold its own without luring (even more) voters away from Zionist allies in its block—the Labor Party and the left-wing Meretz Party—who will have to perform at least as well if not better than expected.

Sentence: More important, Gantz will need the Arab vote to be substantially higher than it has been, both to elect more Arab Knesset members—who would block Netanyahu’s rightists—and to raise the electoral threshold, thus sinking marginal rightist parties.

Sentence: He’s reportedly planning to approach United Torah Judaism, a veteran Haredi party that is traditionally hostile to secular Zionism, but never mind; the Haredim have schools and rabbinic sinecures to protect, and would therefore, at least notionally, be willing to join any government.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Gantz is also courting two small parties that grew out of the Likud.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: First, there is the populist Kulanu (“All Together”), which appeals primarily to Mizrahi Jews, of Middle Eastern descent, who do not see returning to an older Israel, run by descendants of European pioneers, as a plus; Kulanu’s leader, Moshe Kahlon, is currently the finance minister.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Then there is Zehut (“Identity”), which espouses a strange mix of libertarian rhetoric—chiefly, in support of the legalization of weed—and a mystical religious attachment to the settlement movement and to the goal of building a Third Temple on the Temple Mount.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Any of these parties might be willing to join a coalition in exchange for being awarded key ministries, which would likely upset promises made to the leftist parties.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Opponents with a comparatively stronger military background, particularly Blue and White’s generals, could have been a problem; so Netanyahu’s campaign has used social media, aided by timely leaks, to warp Gantz’s record, depicting him as indecisive, weak, possibly compromised by a hacked phone—and, in any case, beholden to Arab voters.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: (An Israeli watchdog group has uncovered a network of hundreds of social-media accounts, many of them fake, used to smear Netanyahu’s opponents.)

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Netanyahu has meanwhile flaunted his personal relationships with Donald Trump, who, in effect, made a campaign video for him, and with Vladimir Putin; brought the new, autocratic Brazilian President, Jair Bolsonaro, to Jerusalem; announced Trump’s recognition of Israel’s Golan Heights annexation; and called up reserves, ostensibly to attack on the Gaza front, while suggesting a behind-the-scenes deal with Hamas.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: He’s projecting indispensability.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Ideally, from his perspective, he would have a five- or six-seat cushion in the Knesset, so that none of the smaller parties could threaten to bring him down or extort too much from coalition negotiations.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Netanyahu would have another incentive, however, to coddle the most extremist of those parties, who, in turn, could play on his legal problems to gain access to power.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: His hearings are scheduled for July and, if he is not cleared, which seems likely, he will be forced to stand trial; according to precedent and Supreme Court rulings, ministers who are indicted must resign.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Netanyahu’s way around this is to form a coalition that will urgently pass two laws.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: The first, already pending in various versions, would give the Knesset the right to overturn, by a simple majority, any Supreme Court decision that strikes down an existing law as unconstitutional; the second would make it illegal to indict a sitting Prime Minister, as opposed to an ordinary minister.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: In effect, Netanyahu would be putting himself above the law.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Only the various ultra-nationalist and Kahanist parties have signalled that they would go along with this plan; Netanyahu is their ticket into the government, and they already regard the Supreme Court as their nemesis.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Pandering to their voters, Netanyahu promised on Saturday that his next government would apply Israeli law to virtually all West Bank settlements—in effect, annexing large swaths of Palestinian territory.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Arguably, this is his most audacious move so far.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: The promise may unsettle some wavering voters, and, ironically, if it draws more rightist voters to the Likud, Netanyahu may gain his plurality at the cost of a smaller rightist party’s failure to pass the threshold, thus weakening or even endangering his bloc’s majority.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Netanyahu wins narrowly—and faces a Likud revolt.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: The former Prime Minister Ehud Olmert, an experienced veteran of similar negotiations, has privately indicated that he doubts senior Likud ministers would be ready to sacrifice their political futures, and give up so many senior positions in the cabinet, just to save the Prime Minister for the few months until his hearings may force him to face trial.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: A unity government is negotiated.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: This is a radical possibility that may appear less so as the post-election dust settles.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: If Netanyahu’s pending indictments were not a stumbling block, the conundrum facing both leading parties would militate for a government of national unity, which would keep out the ultra-rightists and the Kahanists, and could expand to include, say, Labor and Kulanu.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Indeed, in ordinary years, such a government would seem irresistible.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: It might entail a rotation agreement—as Labor and Likud had in a unity government established in 1984—with one leader holding the Prime Minister’s job for the first two years of a four-year term, and the other for the last two.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: This might be interpreted as wanting to wait until the hearings determine, finally, whether the Prime Minister will be indicted.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: Other arrangements might become plausible as the most obvious options narrow.

Sentence: Blue and White leaders might break away and join Netanyahu without Gantz, or various Likud leaders might join with Gantz without Netanyahu.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: And it is hard to see how any unity government—any leaders other than Netanyahu sycophants in the Likud and right-extremists—will agree to hand Netanyahu new laws that tamper with basic constitutional law.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: The only way that he could be moved aside is if Rivlin, who has long been alienated from him, consults with all parties, concedes a virtual tie, and turns to a third member of the Knesset—say, a veteran Likud rival such as Sa’ar—and asks that member to assemble a coalition.

Article Name: Netanyahu, Gantz, and Five Scenarios for the Israeli Election
Sentence: The move would be unprecedented, and it would have to be coördinated with Gantz, but he has already made it clear that he would go for a coalition with the Likud sans Netanyahu—if only to keep the Kahanists out.
